alert.note: Alert for Central Greenville; Southern Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 12:26AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Greenville County through 100 AM EDT... At 1225 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of Greenville Downtown, or near Paris Mountain State Park, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Berea, Welcome, Paris Mountain State Park and Lake Robinson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
